member.name: T:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation
member.summary: Represents the invocation of a background PowerShell pipeline.

member.summary: True if the invocation has finished; otherwise, false.

member.summary: User state object associated with invocation.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.SynchronizedData
member.summary: Values to be shared between host process and the invoked powershell instance.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.StopInvoked
member.summary: True if the background PowerShell instance was stopped before completion; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.Output
member.summary: Output objects returned as a result of the invocation.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.Errors
member.summary: Error records which were generated during the invocation.

member.summary: Warning records which were generated during the invocation.

member.summary: Verbose records which were generated during the invocation.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.Debug
member.summary: Debug records which were generated during the invocation.

member.summary: Invoke PowerShell scripts in the background.

Parameters which represent the behavior and scripts for the background process.

member.summary: Invoke PowerShell scripts in the background.

User state to associate with the results.

Parameters that define the behavior of the invocation

member.summary: Waits for invocation to complete and gets pipeline output.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.BackgroundPipelineInvocation.Stop
member.summary: Stops the execution of the pipeline.

member.summary: This gets called when the results of the pipeline execution are obtained.

member.summary: True if the PowerShell pipeline invocation has completed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets any debug messages that have been produced by the executing PowerShell pipeline.

member.summary: Class which is used to build a PowerShell script pipeline, along with settings for the invocation.

member.summary: Explicitly typed nput data for the first command of the pipeline.

member.summary: Creates and invokes the pipeline asyncrhonously.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddArgument(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an argument for a positional parameter of a command without specifying the parameter name.
member.param: The value of the argument to be added to the last command of the pipeline.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a command to the end of the pipeline of the PowerShell object by specifying the command name.
member.param: The name of the command to be added to the end of the pipeline. Do not include spaces immediately before or after the cmdlet name.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a cmdlet to the end of the pipeline of the PowerShell object, and specifies whether the cmdlet should be run within a new local scope.
member.param: The name of the command to be added to the end of the pipeline. Do not include spaces immediately before or after the cmdlet name.
true to run the cmdlet within a new local scope; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a switch parameter to the last command added to the pipeline.
member.param: The name of the switch parameter to be added.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a parameter and value to the last command added to the pipeline.
member.param: The name of the parameter to be added.
The value of the parameter to be added.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddParameters(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Adds a set of parameters to the last command of the pipeline. The parameter names and values are taken from the keys and values of the dictionary.
member.param: A dictionary of the parameters to be added.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddParameters(System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Adds a set of parameters to the last command of the pipeline. The parameter values are taken from the values in a list.
member.param: A list of the parameters to be added.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddScript(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a script to the end of the pipeline of the PowerShell object.
member.param: The script to be added at the end of the pipeline. This parameter takes a piece of code that is treated as a script when the pipeline is invoked.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddScript(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a script to the end of the pipeline of the PowerShell object, and indicates whether the script should be run in local scope.
member.param: The script to be added at the end of the pipeline. This parameter takes a piece of code that is treated as a script when the pipeline is invoked.

A value that indicates whether the script should be run in local scope. Be aware that when local scope is used, variables will be defined in a new scope so they will not be available when the script is complete.

member.name: M:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocationBuilderBase`2.AddStatement
member.summary: Adds an additional statement to the end of the pipeline.

member.summary: A PSInvocationSettings object that defines how Windows PowerShell handles the invocation of the pipeline, such as whether the commands are added to the session history.

member.name: P:IOUtilityCLR.PSInvocation.PSInvocationContext.Variables
member.summary: Other variables to define when invoking a script.
member.remarks: After a script is executed, the values in this property will not be updated. Instead, the values of these variables wil be represnted in the resulting InvocationResult object.
